column4: When i try to logon use SESSION gnome it goes for about 10 secs then logs back out. I can login using FAILSAFE gnome, any ideas?
hm. weird. can you log in to your failsafe session, open a terminal (Alt+F2, then "gnome-terminal"), do a "cat ~/.xsession-errors" and paste that using pastebin.com or so?
- were do i paste it???
- i done the cat command
- try http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/QWjVwZXP
nice. can you do the same with "dmesg", too?
- how i do that lol
type "dmesg" into the temrinal and paste it, as you did with the xsession-errors.
i.e. "sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade" on your  terminal.
- by the looks of things no as their is 240 to install, only installed  it today
there you go. So update your stuff, reboot, and try again :-)
- ok i will try that, it worked fine on my previous computer but not this one
- you here?
hm. yes. kinda
- i updated but still same problem
hm. weird. again: login failsafe, paste .xsession-errors and dmesg.
- http://pastebin.com/gNRqneZf (xsession)
0 http://pastebin.com/jyYyB6jf (dmesg)
- http://pastebin.com/04FVq33t (dmesg from gnome-session-log)
- i resubmitted the dmesg log (http://pastebin.com/04FVq33t) here this doesn't show the flood
yes, because it's incomplete.
